channel.title: Incheon on Every Corner of Korea

item.title: [Day Trip to Island] To you who have forgotten summer, Trekking Heaven Jangbongdo - Ongjin-gun, Incheon, Korea
item.description:
The sunset seen from the dried fishery beach

[Day Trip to Island] To you who have forgotten summer, Trekking Heaven Jangbongdo

Ongjin-gun, Incheon, Korea

Large and small peaks stood on the sea. Haemu came in and wrapped around comfortably. Gaetti-gil along the ridge has a fresh summer scent. Every time a blade of grass grazes the ankle, the cicadas are rumbling. I stopped walking for a moment and wiped the sweat from my forehead. I sat on a rock and watched the plane take off from Yeongjongdo Island and drank ice water. So I learned how to fly in Jangbongdo in the summer.
A light day trip to the island
Although travel is an everyday age, island travel still leads to the field of enthusiasts. This is because it takes a long time to reach the granularity, making it difficult to travel on a day, and there are many unpredictable variables due to the isolated environment.
Tourist information center, cafe, and tourist center
Nevertheless, the one-day island tour has been actively conducted around Incheon Ongjin-gun. Shin, Si, Modo, Jangbongdo, and Muuidodo, which are close to Yeongjongdo, are typical.
Seagull yawning near the dock
Among them, Jangbong-do is famous for a day-trip trekking spot. The name means `` island with long peaks, '' but there are seven trekking courses along the ridge and coast. Each course has different charms and features, including a fresh course on the 1st course from the marina to the middle of the island, as well as the sky path, the road beyond Gugi, the road to Jangbong Coast, the road to Yadal Mermaid, the path to Handeul Coast, and the path to Jangbong Treasure.
A small rocky island in front of Ongam Village.
Except for the 1st and 2nd courses across the central part of the island, they are all coastal walks along the sea. The sea seen from here is incredibly clean and blue, not to be believed to be the West Sea. At this time, most of the daytime, more of the low tide and tidal flats are revealed, but even this is just beautiful. The sandy tidal flat where the tidal flat meets the tidal rock is called ‘Got Tea’. This is the reason why the name “Got Ti-gil” was named on the trekking course of Jangbong-do.
It is called a remote place because it cannot go as far as it is near.
Twenty-five (one-way) flights a day also allow for a one-day trip. From Yeongjongdo Sammok Wharf, there are one or two ships heading to Jangbong-do almost every hour from 7:10 am to 8:40 pm. It takes about 40 minutes to depart from Sammok and arrive at Jangbongdo via Shindo. Passenger cars and freight cars are also available. Detailed timetable Sejong Shipping 과 Hallym Shipping You can check it on the homepage.
Heading towards the head of a path along the skyway
Trekking in the heat-in search of the head
The first place people visit in Jangbongdo is the tourist center located near the marina.
City bus waiting in front of the marina
Beginners usually ask for directions. Maps detailing the trekking course are not available online, so you will often receive a brochure or advice.
The terminal stop is the starting point of the Jangbong Coastal Road.
When you ask the staff about the ‘most popular course’, you will be introduced to the 2nd course of the course and the 4th course of the Jangbong Coast.
The way to the head.
Most people take the village bus from the marina and get off at the final stop, Chukdong (Jangbong 4-ri / Geoneojang Beach), and then walk along the Jangbong Coastal Road to Gamakmeori, the western end of the island.
Green forest path and stairs
When you return, you follow the ridge path, Heavenly Path, to Jinchon (Jangbong 3-ri), opposite the axis. This is a 3 hour and 30 minute course. You have to make a choice here.
It passes through the ridge road that touches the sky. (Skyway)
If you want to go back to the marina by using the town bus, you need to go a little further to the starting point, Chuk-dong, and if you want to lack momentum, you can continue trekking along the fresh course of Course 1, which leads to the marina. In this case, it takes 6-7 hours.
Pyeongchon (Jangbong 2-ri) seen from Bonghwadae.
Many people are famous for their beautiful sunsets. On the left side of the observatory, you can see the twin uninhabited islands of Seomando and Dongmando side by side. In winter, the sun falls exactly between the two islands. Wherever it goes, it's every thing that you're ecstatic. However, if you do not have specialized equipment such as lanterns, you must hurry up Hassan.
Gamagori Observatory
Observation deck ban is forbidden, so if you spend your time, you will wander in the dark. There are many sunset points around the village, such as the dried fish beach and Yadal dock, so there is no need to be sad.
Stamp post installed on the observation deck.

A trekking paradise is not a smooth road. There are few decks or stairs and most of them are made of dirt and rocks, which can be difficult for those unfamiliar with climbing. In addition, grass and trees are lush when there is a shower in the summer, making some areas uncomfortable. The fresh play path and the sky path (under difficulty) stretching along the main ridgeline are relatively wide and flat, but the Jangbong Coastal Path (on difficulty level) is narrow and rough, so it is recommended to avoid trekking beginners as much as possible. Even if it is not a coastal road, keep in mind that Jangbongdo itself has long ridges and repeats the uphill and downhill paths, so it is easy to get tired even if the course is short.

A panoramic view of Jangbongdo Island from the Bonghwadae. It looks like a long mountain peak.
Jangbongdo's Hidden Treasure
① Beach with tidal flats
There are 5 beaches in Jangbong-do. Ongam Beach, the closest to the marina, is a representative tourist attraction with various restaurants and convenient facilities. On weekends, camping crowds are so crowded that the field is filled with tents. The wide tidal flat is a playground for children to play freely. 뙤 It's busy picking up shellfish or crabs without worrying about the sun. Jangbongdo is a mudflat everywhere. In the distant sea, there are several places of grass. In some places, the depths are deep and the water is fast. It was called the golden fishing ground from the Joseon Dynasty for a good reason.
Quiet and quiet weekday afternoon Ongam Beach
There are also mermaid legends related to abundant fishery resources. The fisherman Choi Choi, who hit the ball every day, was delighted to find a mermaid caught in the net one day, but the eyes seemed so sad that he put it back to the sea, and since then, every time a fisherman throws a net, a fish is caught. In fact, you can meet a mermaid statue built at the dock in Jangbongdo to remember the mermaid's boeun.
Sister picking something up from tidal flat
② Delicious seafood
Sanghap, Sora, and clams are seafood representing Jangbongdo. The elderly in the village go out near the grass and offshore in small streets to catch up. Mussels are lilies belonging to the most expensive species of shellfish. It is caught a lot in the nearby tidal flats, but the bigger and better the competition is, the farther it goes out to sea. Sora is the same. It comes from the tidal flats and from the sea, and the mussel is bigger and tastes better. The collected sashimi is purchased at the village restaurant. Mussels and clams are kalguksu, and sora is served in bibimbap.
Sorbibimbap at the “Sky Garden” restaurant, which boasts a colorful color
Sora Bibimbap, jointly developed by Incheon City and Cheongwoon University, is a representative menu of Jangbongdo. The fat seashell was full. Even the first chapter contains the philosophy and spirit of the food maker. The ‘Sky Garden’ plant is sweet and not spicy with apples, plums, and pears. For customers who don't have a good stomach, they make instant soy sauce.
Adult palm size
After trekking and feeling the nature and taste of Jangbong-do, the day and night quickly stop. The last boat to Yeongjongdo Sammok Wharf is 9:20 PM. When I return to 뭍, I feel like I was in a different world today. 1 hour 30 minutes from Seoul. There is a magical world that makes hot air forget this near.
Sanghap Kalguksu with a light and rich taste
Travel information

Jangbongdo

-Address: Jangbong-ri, Bukdo-myeon, Ongjin-gun, Incheon

-Inquiries: 032-899-3410 http://www.jangbongdo.com/

-Travel Tip: Ministry of Oceans and Fisheries National Maritime Research Institute smart tidal forecast

http://www.khoa.go.kr/swtc/main.do Travel by reference!


※ The above information was updated in August 2019, and may change later, so be sure to check it before you travel.

※ Information, such as text, photos, and videos used in this article, is copyrighted by the Korea Tourism Organization, and unauthorized use of the article is prohibited.

item.title: Rediscovering old buildings that shine as they get older, analog walks at Incheon Port - Jung-gu, Incheon, Korea
item.description:
Café spot, designated as a modern cultural heritage

Rediscovering old buildings that shine as they get older, analog walks at Incheon Port

Jung-gu, Incheon, Korea

Next to the bustling Chinatown, Incheon Open Port Modern History and Culture Town has a history of more than 130 years after opening. Compared to Chinatown, spaces that resemble black and white photographs seem to be hidden in the more leisurely streets. I found a space that has been reborn as a sensuous cafe or gallery by recycling buildings that have been lit up with traces of time. Let's walk through the faded time.
Reborn of a 100-year-old wooden house, cafe pot
When you go to the Incheon Jung-gu Office, the Japanese wooden houses create an exotic scenery. It is a painful trace of the looting after the opening of Incheon in 1883, but the scenery in which Chinatown and Japanese buildings are clearly divided is distinctive. In the streets of old churches, cafes, and museums, the buildings bearing the sign of 'Korea Modern Cultural Heritage' stand out. It is a cafe pot that has entered a 3-story wooden house for over 100 years. On weekends, it is always crowded with people looking for red bean porridge and red bean shaved ice.
Baek Young-im, who has been a citizen cultural movement in Incheon, opened a cafe here because of the value of architecture. This building was an office and a lodging company for over 100 Korean workers in Japan. After liberation, it was used for various purposes such as herbal medicine, Nonghyup, and newspapers. As it was revealed that the building was built between the late 1880s and the early 1890s, the white sand beach was examined with expert advice to see if it was worth preserving. As far as the record goes, there have been no cases where three-storey Japanese-style combined use houses remain intact. The interior structure was made as long as possible and hung on the restoration work for a long time.
Window seat facing the open port street
"I think it's better to keep what is left than to make it new. It was a pity that modern buildings in Incheon disappeared before they even announced their value. Even if it was restored, I hoped that it would be a cafe where people can come and go more easily than a space stuffed with history. I did it. "
In the following year, Fatal was designated as a registered cultural property No. 567 in recognition of its architectural value.
Myeongdang of Fatal connected to the outside garden
Inside the cafe, there is an old-fashioned atmosphere. Hand-held accessories, such as a wooden ceiling exposed in the old way, a small garden in the back yard, a table using a sewing machine used by my mother, and a phone made in 1918, matched nicely. Postcards and brochures are displayed at the entrance of the cafe where you can see the port opening season. On the 2nd to 3rd floor, there is a tatami room operated by reservation system.
2nd floor tatami room with black and white photos
Patal's representative menu is Nagasaki Castella, which is baked with plenty of red bean porridge made from domestic red beans, red bean ice water, and honey. There are many customers who visit the cafeteria near the school and remember the taste of red bean porridge that they bought and bought five times ago. Along with sweet red bean porridge, there are many customers who visit red bean shaved ice, which is sold only for 100 bowls a day on weekends, and castella, which was a gift for weddings in the 1960s and 1970s.
Sweet red bean porridge with chewy injeolmi and cinnamon scent
Ganghwa-do glutinous rice and glutinous rice cake made from domestic red beans are good to serve with black tea.
Glutinous rice cake made in a cooperative made up of local bakeries in Incheon
Gwandong Gallery, a house with a 90-year-old tree fragrance
From Fatal, enter Incheon Jung-gu Office and enter the alley on the left, leading to the Kwandong Gallery. After the opening, consulates and police stations were concentrated in this area. There were many government offices, so it was named Kanto. Named after the region, the Kwandong Gallery opens a unique exhibition by taking advantage of the regional characteristics of the cultural junction between Korea, China and Japan.
Current status of Kwandong Gallery

Traces of more than 90 years old are hidden in various places around the small exhibition hall. It is the couple of Ikuko Toda and photographer Eun-Gyu Ryu, who inadvertently breathe new life into an old house that might be overlooked, who went on a study abroad trip to Korea more than 30 years ago. In the Kanto region, which was a Japanese concession, there are Japanese town houses in the form of 'Machiya'. Kwandong Gallery is one of them. When viewed from outside the building, six two-storey buildings are placed side by side, and it is an unusual townhouse with a common courtyard behind the building.

"The house lives longer than people. From the 1920s to the 1930s, many people have gone through this house. Every time I tear off the ceiling and find a hidden space, I feel like breathing with a long time. It's a pleasure that you can't enjoy in an apartment. . "

Gwandong Gallery before construction
The attic provided on the second floor of the exhibition hall is a space where you can feel the excitement of reproduction. During the work of dismantling the ceiling, I found that the girder was connected from next door to next door. The secret space, which had been hiding for nearly 90 years, was renovated into a loft library where anyone can sit and read books after a minimal fee.
2nd floor exhibition hall and attic to guess the age of the building
Most of them are modern history books of Korea, China, and Japan, collections of photos, and books related to art. The more you look back and forth, the more attractive it is to see the invisible place and the charm of the wooden architecture and the sense of modern recycling of the old space. It is the result of revealing and utilizing the old and flawed parts rather than covering them.
2nd floor exhibition hall and attic to guess the age of the building
There is a bright space behind the prop shop on the first floor. This is a drawing room and guest room that has been converted from an old kitchen.
Reception room and guest room
Walls with peeling paint, old water pipes, and windows facing a 100-year-old stone wall seem to have a long story.
Reception room and guest room
The accessory shop on the first floor is full of vintage objects from various regions such as Japan, China, and Zimbabwe. Even the props, such as a 100-year-old travel bag and old wooden dolls, that the enema couples had directly obtained from Yanbian, resemble this space.
When entering the gallery, the first prop shop that greets you
Travel information

Fatal

-Address: 96-2 Sinpo-ro 27beon-gil, Jung-gu, Incheon
-Opening hours: 11 am to 10 pm / Closed on Mondays
-Menu: sweet red bean porridge, red bean shaved ice, Nagasaki castella
-Inquiries: 032-777-8686

http://www.pot-r.com/

Kwandong Gallery
-Address: 38, Sinpo-ro 31beon-gil, Jung-gu, Incheon
-Opening hours: 10 am to 6 pm / Closed Monday to Thursday
-Inquiries: 032-766-8660

http://www.gwandong.co.kr/

Restaurants near
-Shinseungbanjeom: Unijajang, Tangsuyuk / 31-3, Chinatown-ro 44beon-gil, Jung-gu / 032-762-9467

-Shandong Kitchen: Tantan-myeon, Shandong Steamed Dumpling / 38 Chinatown-ro, Jung-gu / 032-765-6566
-Sipnihyang: Hwadeok Mandu / 50-2 Chinatown-ro, Jung-gu / 032-762-5888


Rooms

-Olympos Hotel: 257 Jemulyang-ro, Jung-gu / 032-762-5181

http://olymposhotel.co.kr/main.asp

-Harbor Park Hotel: 217 Jemulyang-ro, Jung-gu / 032-770-9500

http://www.harborparkhotel.com/

-Nest Hotel: 19-5 Yeongjonghaeannam-ro, Jung-gu / 032-743-9000

item.title: A trip to September, with trees, and Incheon Grand Park Wood Culture Experience Center Mokyeon-ri - Namdong-gu, Incheon, Korea
item.description:
World Architecture Award and Red Dot Design Award Main Prize

A trip to September, with trees, and Incheon Grand Park Wood Culture Experience Center Mokyeon-ri

Namdong-gu, Incheon, Korea

I have a carpenter friend. When asked about the merits of work, the answer is, "I can touch the tree." I also like to touch trees. The texture of the wood is 'emotional' compared to other objects. Not smooth but calm While living in wood, even after dying in furniture and books. So when you touch a tree, 'good' and 'reliable' are pushed to one side of your heart.

#Woodworking experience # Mokyeon-ri #Incheon Arboretum #Incheon Arboretum #Attractions #Amazing Dating #September Travel #Nagolo Walking #Half Day Family Outing #Design Tour #Art Tour #Architecture #World Architecture Awards #Red Dot Design Award #Ecology learning

On a clear autumn day, I went to Incheon to touch the trees. There are many wood culture experience places. But why is it Incheon? Mokyeon-ri, a wooden cultural experience center in Incheon Grand Park, is a special place. One huge design.
Incheon Grand Park Wood Culture Experience Center
Unlike the existing timber culture center, it is a modern exposed concrete building. Special wooden devices also give life to the body. Or is it the World Architecture Community (WAC) World Architecture Award and the Red Dot Design Award Concept? The name of the grand park, the zelkova tunnel, the buckwheat blossoms and the cosmos under the ground can also make you flutter.
1st floor ambience wall
Make Dad and Mom Together: With Family
Mokyeon-ri, Incheon Grand Park Wood Culture Experience Center, is a two-story building. On the first floor, there is a ginkgo workshop used by elementary school students and adults. The zelkova workshop on the second floor has a family. Children make their parents, cloud-shaped plates, planes, and so on. Although it is at the level of duke, the imagination of the filmmaker's hand is rough.
Incheon Grand Park Wood Culture Experience Center Mokyeon-ri
Next to the zelkova workshop on the 2nd floor is the Cloud Playground. It is full of wooden toys such as tool play and train play. The pool full of cypress balls is especially popular. It's a phytoncide playground. The lobby on the second floor is rich in wood, due to the tight planks on the ceiling.
Incheon Arboretum Promenade
You may want to give the children an explanation of a tree like a cypress ball pool.
Cloud Playground Cypress Ball Pool
There is a nail and sawing experience in the lobby on the first floor. If you drop by, it's worth a try. There is an angel wing photo zone on the entrance wall of the building. Wood Experience Center Mokyeon-ri is adjacent to Incheon Arboretum. It is a good size for a light walk with children. If you want to visit the grand park together, the southern wetlands, pampas grass, and infant forest experience center are suitable for autumn ecological learning.
Ginkgo workshop woodwork experience for elementary school students and adults
Like a tree if you love: with a lover or friend
Ginkgo workshop on the first floor is perfect when you're with a lover or a friend. Make living supplies such as wooden speakers, mini-shops, and reading stands. It is a form of assembling wooden boards prepared in advance, but the process of touching and pasting wood is more interesting than you think. Sometimes they come in loved ones or friends and make each other's gifts.
To relax and enjoy Mokyeon-ri's architecture, head to the outdoor deck shelter next to the 2nd Floor Cloud Playground. Corresponds to the inside of the triangle's acute angle. In the circumference, a wooden board shaped like '∧' is stacked to form a screen. In the meantime, relax and enjoy the view of Incheon Grand Park or Arboretum. Floor patterns vary when shadows are cast. Carpentry experiences are scheduled for both workshops twice a week and three weekends. The experience fee (excluding material cost) is inexpensive at 2000-3000 won.
Pin McMoon-Dong Flower on Grand Park Walkway
After leaving Mokyeon-ri, go to Incheon Grand Park zelkova path. Zelkova trees are tunneled and romantic. Even before the autumn leaves are worth seeing. By mid-September, the purple McMoon-Dong flowers are present in India.
Oul Garden where you can see the flowers and cosmos
Lovers are encouraged to rent bicycles for couples at the bike square. If you rent a bicycle, you will go to the alumni garden of the Alumni side. In late September, buckwheat flowers are in full bloom. There are several beans in the middle of the buckwheat field. Why don't you read a book and make a fairy tale in autumn? Cosmos that sometimes fly adds to the mood of autumn.
Zelkova road couple bicycle
Alone Design Tour: Solo Yolo
Let's take a design tour for a trip alone. Incheon Grand Park Wood Culture Experience Center Mok Yeon Lee was noted as one of the 'hot' buildings in the first half, winning the World Architecture Community World Architecture Award after the Red Dot Design Award Concept Award.
Incheon Grand Park Wood Culture Experience Center
The first thing to look out for is the `` Ambience Wall, '' which decorates the first floor and the second floor. It is the name of the screen which stacked 8 ~ 9 wooden boards shaped like '∧' on the exterior of a building.
Ambience Wall is another highlight of shadow changes
I embodied our traditional door. The appearance varies depending on the direction you are looking, adding to the pleasure of taking pictures. Ambience Wall is a kinetic architecture (moving architecture) that distinguishes wood culture experiences from other architectural designs.
Ambience wall looks different depending on direction
There is also a hidden function. The stacked '∧' angle increases and decreases as the pole moves. However, it's a pity that you can't see it because it is only tested in special cases. Nevertheless, with that in mind, the building looks more abundant.
Building concrete wall wood pattern
For photography, we recommend a trail that enters from the park stand. Brown 'ambience walls' stand out among the pine branches. The interior contrasts the pattern of two-storey oak planks and ambience walls. At sunset, the shadows of the ambience wall change to create an interesting pattern. The concrete part of the building is colorful, expressing the texture of the tree.
Ambience Wall comes in a variety of photos depending on the direction

If you just feel sorry for Mokyeonri, you will take a walk to the Arboretum. Relaxing for about an hour along the forest path. If you walk alone, the trees in the forest seem to touch your heart.


Traffic tips: When using the subway in Seoul, it is faster to transfer the bus at Songnae Station than Incheon Grand Park Station. From July, the limited express (Yongsan Station-Dongincheon Station) subway will operate nine one-way trips (between 9:00 am and 5:00 pm). It takes 26 minutes from Yongsan Station to Songnae Station.

Arboretum entrance with willow
Travel info

Incheon Grand Park Wood Culture Experience Center Mokyeon-ri

-Address: 238, Munemi-ro, Namdong-gu, Incheon (Incheon Grand Park Wood & Cultural Experience Center)

Inquiries: 032-440-5850, 5822

-Hours: 10: 00 ~ 17: 00, closed on Mondays

http://grandpark.incheon.go.kr/index.do


Restaurants near

-Battered crab: Soy crab / 22 Jonghyeon Farm, Namhyeon-gu / 032-466-0304

-Yeongkwang Charcoal Grilled Eel: Freshwater Eel / 190-1, Manuigol-ro, Namdong-gu / 032-465-1999

-Chugatjipeotang: Chueotang / 3536, Suin-ro, Namdong-gu / 032-466-6046


Rooms

-Stella Marina Hotel: 51, Nonhyeon-ro 46beon-gil, Namdo / 032-426-1100

http://www.stellarmarinahotel.com/

-IOS Hotel: 25, Daejeong-ro 82beon-gil, Bupyeong-gu / 032-512-2253

-Economy Hotel Incheon Bupyeong Branch: 88-6 Bupyeong-daero 296beon-gil, Bupyeong-gu / 032-529-4941

item.title: 4.5 billion Asian festivals! Compete for over 3000 medals in 36 events
item.description:
Opening ceremony of the 17th Incheon Asian Games

4.5 billion Asian festivals! Compete for over 3000 medals in 36 events

Seo-gu, Incheon, South Korea

On September 19, the 17th Incheon Asian Games started with the opening ceremony of Incheon Asiad Main Stadium in Incheon, Korea. 45 Asian countries, including Korea, China, and Japan, compete for over 3000 medals in 36 sports (28 Olympics and 8 Olympics) including basketball, rugby, archery, weightlifting, swimming, canoeing and boxing. The event, which includes all members of the Asian Olympic Council (OCA), including North Korea, will be held for 16 days until October 4. The third Asian Games to be held in Korea is the third after Seoul in 1986 and Busan in 2002. As of 2014, only Thailand (4) and South Korea have hosted more than three Asian Games.

Departure begins at the opening ceremony of Incheon Asiad Main Stadium on September 19, 2014
Before looking at the full schedule, let's take a look at the Incheon Asiad Main Stadium, which was completed for the Incheon Asian Games. It boasts a floor area of 11,620m2 (approximately 34,000 pyeong) and five floors and more than 60,000 seats. The competition started with the opening ceremony of Incheon Asiad Main Stadium. It is held in Incheon and Suwon Gymnasium (Handball), Munhak Park Tae-hwan Swimming Pool (Swimming). If you're a sports fan, it's a good idea to check the location of the stadium to create a line.
Opening Ceremony of 2014 Incheon Asian Games
A game of over 3000 medals. How should we look? Since we cannot introduce all the schedules, we arranged the schedules focusing on handball, swimming, archery, and gymnastics games loved by Koreans, mainly soccer, baseball, and basketball.
Opening Torch Light

First of all, the soccer became fun until the 2002 Korea-Japan World Cup. The final will take place at the Literature Stadium on October 2. In the soccer qualifiers held on September 21st, the Korean men's team beat Laos 2-0 and the women's team beat Maldives 13-0. Baseball, which started on the 22nd, won 15-0 against Thailand. The semi-finals and finals will take place on the 27th and 28th after the match against Hong Kong on the 24th. All take place at the Literary Baseball Stadium. Basketball is scheduled to play against Jordan at the Samsan World Gymnasium on the 25th. On the 28th, the quarter finals will be held at the Hwaseong Stadium.

Kim Young-Soo Chairman, Organizing Committee, Asian Games
Match schedule? It's not difficult!

Marine Boy Park Tae-hwan's swimming game is not to be missed. On the 21st, they won bronze medals in the men's freestyle 200m final and the men's freestyle 400m final on the 23rd. The freestyle 100m preliminaries are scheduled for 9 am on the 25th.

Gymnastics Fairy Son Yeon-jae will compete in the rhythmic gymnastics individual qualifiers on October 1 at Namdong Gymnasium. The rhythmic gymnastics consists of four events: ribbon, ball, club and hoop. There was a medal in gymnastics. On the 23rd, Lee Sang-wook won the bronze medal in the Men's Gymnastics Men's Final, and Yun Na-rae added another bronze medal in the Women's Individual Final. On the 24th, Yang Hak-sun will play in the final match of the gymnastics men's floor exercise, and will play against Li Segwang of North Korea. Gymnastics is the exercise of postponing body movements using machines. Express stability, difficulty, elegance and originality. Men's sports are Maru, Cheolbong, Parallel Bar, Massage, Ring, Chopping Board, and Women's Floor, Average Bar, Double Parallel Bar, Chopping Board.
Traditional medallion archery. The Republic of Korea breathes on a single arrow that cuts off the target. Archery won eight gold medals, including the 2014 Incheon Asian Games and the newly added compound. In the men's group qualification round (compound) held on the 23rd, Choi Yong-hee (2nd) and Yang Young-ho (5th) played in the men's individual qualification round. The women's team also took first place in the Compound Women's Qualifying Round and Choi Bo-min (1st) and Seok Ji-hyun (2nd) in the individual qualification round. The game is played every day until the 28th.
Wait here! There are two types of archery: a recurve bow and a compound bow. All archery we have seen in the meantime is recurve. Compound archery hasn't been an Olympic or Asian competition. However, attention has been increasing as it was adopted as a regular sport since the Incheon Asian Games. What is the difference between the two? As the name implies, the bow structure is different. If the recurve is a traditional bow, the compound is a mechanical bow. The recurve is heavy and sensitive, so the player's concentration is important. Thinking of the archery field in the meantime makes it easier to understand. Compounds, on the other hand, are lighter and smaller than mechanical arrowhead recurve arrows that are easy to learn for beginners with pulleys and sights.
In the finals of the badminton men's team where the opposition hero Lee Yong-dae played on the 23rd, he added a gold medal. The men's and women's mixed singles and doubles games will be held until the 29th. In addition, medal competitions will be held in 36 events including judo, shooting, cycling, and land. As of September 24, 2014, South Korea is ranked second overall with 61 medals, including 20 gold, 19 silver and 22 bronze.
Judo Qualification
Indeed, don't forget the seal of three children, Vichuon, Barame, and Chumyeon, the mascots of the Incheon Asian Games. The mascot of the convention has influenced the image of the competition. As the name suggests, the eldest son of the Incheon Asian Games, Bichuon, is, as the name suggests, 'the messenger of light shining hope on the whole world'. Was taken from. Why don't you enjoy the festival of autumn, wind, light and wind?
Panoramic view of Literary Park Tae Hwan Swimming Pool
Travel info
